name: src/battle/Battle.js
Battle
description: This class manages the battle and combat logic.

name: constructor
description: Creates the battle room

params.name: room
params.description: The room the battle is occurring in

params.name: edge
params.description: The edge the player entered from

name: room
description: The room the battle is occurring in

name: startEdge
description: The edge the player entered from

name: scene
description: The current scene

name: currentEnemy
description: The enemy that is currently selected in the battle

name: enemyIndex
description: The index of the currently selected enemy

name: playerTurn
description: Whether or not it is the player's turn

name: active
description: Whether or not the battle is active and running

name: minigame
description: Stores information about the minigame currently being played

name: update
description: Updates the battle

name: slayAll
description: Slays all of the enemies

name: begin
description: Begins combat inside of the a battle room

return.description: The promise when the battle has been initialized

name: end
description: Ends the combat inside of the battle room

return.description: The promise when the battle has ended

name: movePlayer
description: Moves the player to face enemies

name: centerCameraToRoom
description: Stops player movement and centers the camera in the battle room

name: centerCameraOnPlayer
description: Centers the camera on the player

return.description: The promise when the camera has been centered

name: lockRoom
description: Adds the doors to the room to lock the player in for battle

return.description: The promise when the room has been locked

name: unlockRoom
description: Removes the doors from the room

name: playMinigame
description: Opens the given mini game and pauses the game until mini game is over

params.name: enemy
params.description: The enemy spawning the mini game

params.name: difficulty
params.description: The difficulty of the mini game

name: continueCombat
description: Stops the current mini game and resumes the game

params.name: result
params.description: The result of the mini game

name: performEnemyAttack
description: Performs an enemy attack

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the attacking enemy

return.description: The promise when the enemy is done attacking

BattleDrop

baseConfig

2D grid matching map dimensions where every element contains an array of

Generates two random hallways between two random rooms to try and make a
loop in the dungeon.

description: Checks to see if the given room can fit inside the dungeon

return.description: True if the room can fit in the dungeon

name: getRoomAt

return.description: The room at the coordinate

name: Room

Each room in a dungeon has walls, floor, and doors. Also entities live within

the level.

description: The width of the room in tiles

description: The doors in the room

Sets the position of the room in the dungeon. Also updates positional

params.name: y

params.name: edge

The layer to show

Dims the lights in the given room. Once the light is dimmed, it is removed
from the game to ease up graphics.

Injection

This is a health booster that can only be used when the player has health
below their maximum health. If the player's health is already full, the
player is injured (what a twisted society we live in)

Player

The movement destination of the player. Used when moving the player

name: src/globals.js
content:
/**
 * @typedef {Object} SpriteConfig
 * @property {Phaser.Scene} scene The current scene
 * @property {number} x The horizontal position
 * @property {number} y The vertical position
 * @property {string} key The key of the texture used to render the sprite
 */

/**
 * @typedef {Object} ItemUseConfig
 * @property {Phaser.Scene} scene The current scene
 * @property {Battle} battle The current battle
 * @property {MiniGame} minigame The current minigame
 */

/**
 * @typedef {Object} HealthBarConfig
 * @property {number} width The width in pixels
 * @property {number} height The height in pixels
 * @property {number} x The horizontal position in the world
 * @property {number} y The vertical position in the world
 * @property {number} backgroundColor The background color of the bar
 * @property {number} barColor The color of the health bar
 * @property {{color: number, width: number}} border The configuration for the 
 *           border
 * @property {number} animationDuration Time in ms for the bar to change width
 */

/**
 * @typedef {Object} DungeonConfig
 * @property {number} width The width in tiles
 * @property {number} height The height in tiles
 * @property {number} randomSeed A seed for RNG
 * @property {number} doorPadding The number of tiles required on each side of a
 *           door
 * @property {RoomConfig} rooms The configuration for generating rooms
 */

/**
 * @typedef {Object} RoomConfig
 * @property {RandomNumberRange} width The width in tiles
 * @property {RandomNumberRange} height The height in tiles
 * @property {number} maxArea The maximum possible area
 * @property {number} maxRooms The maximum number of rooms allowed for
 *           generation
 */

/**
 * @typedef {Object} RandomNumberRange
 * @property {number} min The minimum possible number
 * @property {number} max The maximum possible number
 * @property {boolean} even True means only even numbers. False means only odd
 *           numbers. Undefined means all numbers.
 */

/**
 * @typedef {Object} RoomAttachment
 * @property {number} x The horizontal tile position
 * @property {number} y The vertical tile position
 * @property {Room} target The room to attach
 * @property {number} dist The distance between the two rooms
 * @property {Direction} direction The direction to the room attachment
 */

/**
 * @typedef {Object} TilePosition
 * @property {number} x The horizontal tile position
 * @property {number} y The vertical tile position
 */

/**
 * @typedef {Object} Door
 * @property {number} x The horizontal tile position
 * @property {number} y The vertical tile position
 * @property {Edge} edge The edge of the room the door lies on 
 */

/**
 * An enum describing a direction (NORTH, EAST, SOUTH, WEST)
 */
const Direction = {
  NORTH: 0,
  EAST: 1,
  SOUTH: 2,
  WEST: 3
};

/**
 * An enum describing orientation (VERTICAL, HORIZONTAL)
 */
const Orientation = {
  VERTICAL: 0,
  HORIZONTAL: 1
};

/**
 * An enum describing an edge (NONE, TOP, RIGHT, BOTTOM, LEFT)
 */
const Edge = {
  NONE: -1,
  TOP: 0,
  RIGHT: 1,
  BOTTOM: 2,
  LEFT: 3
};

/**
 * An enum describing a room type (START, BATTLE, ITEM, HALLWAY, END)
 */
const RoomType = {
  START: 0,
  BATTLE: 1,
  ITEM: 2,
  HALLWAY: 3,
  END: 4
};

/**
 * An enum describing minigame difficulty (EAST, INTERMEDIATE, ADVANCED)
 */
const Difficulty = {
  EASY: 1,
  INTERMEDIATE: 2,
  ADVANCED: 3
};

export { Direction, Orientation, RoomType, Edge, Difficulty };

properties.name: key
properties.description: The key of the texture used to render the sprite

properties.name: x
properties.description: The horizontal position in the world

properties.name: y
properties.description: The vertical position in the world

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: The background color of the bar

properties.name: barColor
properties.description: The color of the health bar

properties.name: animationDuration
properties.description: Time in ms for the bar to change width

properties.name: doorPadding
properties.description:
The number of tiles required on each side of a
          door

properties.name: maxRooms
properties.description:
The maximum number of rooms allowed for
          generation

properties.name: even
properties.description:
True means only even numbers. False means only odd
          numbers. Undefined means all numbers.

properties.name: dist
properties.description: The distance between the two rooms

properties.name: direction
properties.description: The direction to the room attachment

properties.name: edge
properties.description: The edge of the room the door lies on

name: Direction
description: An enum describing a direction (NORTH, EAST, SOUTH, WEST)

name: Orientation
description: An enum describing orientation (VERTICAL, HORIZONTAL)

name: RoomType
description: An enum describing a room type (START, BATTLE, ITEM, HALLWAY, END)

name: Edge
description: An enum describing an edge (NONE, TOP, RIGHT, BOTTOM, LEFT)

name: Difficulty
description: An enum describing minigame difficulty (EAST, INTERMEDIATE, ADVANCED)

name: src/main.js
config
description: The configuration object for the Phaser Game instance

name: src/minigames/DanceDance.js
DanceDance
description:
The Dance Dance mini game is like DDR and the player needs to complete the
arrow combination in order before time expires. If a mistake is made or time
runs out, the player loses.

name: constructor
description: Creates a DanceDance mini game object

name: name
description: The name of the minigame

name: description
description: The description of the minigame

name: text
description: The text displayed quickly to the user before the minigame begins

name: duration
description: The time duration of the mini game in ms

name: comboLength
description: The length of the combo required to successfully complete the minigame

name: combo
description: The key combination required to complete the minigame

name: danceText
description: The text displayed to the user to show the combination required

name: inputCount
description: The number of times the key was pressed during the minigame

name: src/minigames/index.js
src/minigames/MiniGame.js
MiniGame
description: Base class for all mini games

name: constructor
description: Creates a mini game within the current scene

name: key
description: The scene key

name: name
description: The name of the minigame

name: description
description: The description of the minigame

name: text
description: The text displayed quickly to the user before the minigame begins

name: duration
description: The time duration of the mini game in ms

name: elapsedTime
description: The amount of time elapsed in ms since the minigame started

name: started
description: Whether or not the minigame has started

name: x
description: The horizontal position of the minigame window

name: y
description: The vertical position of the minigame window

name: difficulty
description: The difficulty of the minigame

name: timeScale
description: The time scale applied to the duration of the minigame

name: parent
description: The parent scene that created this minigame

name: w
description: The width of the game

name: h
description: The height of the game

name: alertText
description: The text graphic displayed to the user quickly before the minigame starts

name: startTimeout
description: The ID of the timeout used for starting the minigame

name: timerBar
description: The graphics bar used to display the amount of time left in the minigame

name: create
description: Initializes data when the mini game is created

name: keys
description: Object used to store the keys available for use in the minigame

name: update
description: Updates every tick of the game loop

params.name: delta
params.description: The delta time in ms since the last frame

name: openInventory
description: Opens the inventory

name: closeInventory
description: Closes the inventory

params.name: item
params.description: The item selected from the inventory

name: startGame
description: Called right before the mini game starts

name: updateMiniGame
description:
This method will only be updated once the mini game has officially started.
The mini game will start after the alert text disappears.

params.name: delta
params.description: The delta time in ms since the last frame

name: win
description: Called when the mini game has been won. Will redirect back to combat.

name: lose
description: Called when the mini game has been lost. Will redirect back to combat.

name: reset
description: Resets the mini game to its original state to be played again.

name: src/scenes/BootScene.js
BootScene
description:
The boot scene, or splash screen, is used to initialize most of the game
objects and images. The preload method will be mostly utilized. Once all
assets are loaded, the title scene is started.

name: constructor
description: Initializes the boot scene

name: loadSprites
description: Loads the sprites

name: loadItems
description: Loads the items

name: loadItem
description: Loads the image for an item based on its name

name: src/scenes/elements/Message.js
Message
description: A display message that appears

name: status
description: Creates a status message at the bottom of the screen

params.name: scene
params.description: The scene to show the message on

name: src/scenes/GameScene.js
GameScene
description:
The game scene is the main scene used when the player is in actual game play.
All mini game and dungeon gameplay will be from this scene.

name: constructor
description: Initializes the game scene

name: roomCooloffs
description:
A collection of the timeouts currently pending based on the number of
rooms visited since the timeout was added

name: keys
description: A collection of the keys available for use in the game

name: enemyGroup
description: The scene groups to hold all of the enemies present

name: battle
description: The current battle in progress

name: dungeon
description: The dungeon the player is currently in

name: mapWidthInPixels
description: The width of the map in pixels

name: mapHeightInPixels
description: The height of the map in pixels

name: map
description: The current map displayed to the user

name: groundLayer
description: The general layer building the dungeon (walls, floors)

name: stuffLayer
description: The layer that contains all of the objects in the dungeon (i.e. doors)

name: tilemapVisibility
description: Used to show / hide the dungeon

name: player
description: The player in the dungeon

name: pause
description: Pauses the game

name: unpause
description: Unpauses the game

name: openInventory
description: Opens the inventory

name: closeInventory
description: Closes the inventory

params.name: item
params.description: The item selected from the inventory

name: configCameraHUD
description: Creates the HUD camera

name: updateMapVisibility
description: Updates the visibility of the map

name: beginCombat
description: Begins combat inside of a battle room

params.name: room
params.description: The room to begin a battle in

params.name: edge
params.description: The edge the player entered on

name: endCombat
description: Ends the combat inside of the battle room

name: createDungeonMap
description: Creates the map of the dungeon

name: createHallway
description: Creates a hallway on the ground layer

name: createRoom
description: Creates a room on the ground layer

name: createPlayer
description: Adds a player to the room. Also adds colliders to existing layers.

name: stuffCollider
description:
The collider used to detect collisions between the player and the stuff
layer

name: formatCamera
description:
Formats the camera to the generated dungeon, starts following the player
object, and sets the render pipelines for layers affected by light

name: gameOver
description: Called when the player is dead

name: src/scenes/InventoryScene.js
InventoryScene
description: The inventory scene is the scene that displays the inventory to the player.

name: constructor
description: Initializes the inventory scene

name: x
description: The horizontal position of the scene

name: y
description: The vertical position of the scene

name: parent
description: The parent scene used to initiate this scene

name: inventory
description: The inventory to display

name: context
description:
The item context to help display to the user only the items that can be
used at that given time

name: create
description: Initializes data when the inventory is created

name: w
description: The width of the game

name: h
description: The height of the game

name: keys
description: A collection of keys available for use in the inventory

name: update
description: Updates every tick of the game loop

params.name: delta
params.description: The delta time in ms since the last frame

name: src/scenes/PauseScene.js
PauseScene
description: The pause scene is the scene displayed when hitting the ESC key in the game

name: parent
description: The parent scene used to initiate this scene

name: create
description: Initializes data when the pause scene is created

name: keys
description: A collection of keys available for use in the inventory

name: update
description: Updates every tick of the game loop

params.name: delta
params.description: The delta time in ms since the last frame

name: src/scenes/TitleScene.js
TitleScene
description:
The title scene displays the main menu for the player to choose what they
would like to do

name: constructor
description: Initializes the title scene

name: gameTitle
description: The title of the game

name: version
description: The current version of the game

name: index
description: The menu index of the option currently selected

name: options
description: A collection of menu options displayed to the user

name: keys
description: A collection of keys available for use in the inventory

name: selectOption
description: Performs an action based on the current selected index

name: src/util/Animation.js
addStaticAnim
description:
Adds a static animation to the given scene. A static animation is a one
frame animation that doesn't change.

params.name: scene
params.description: The scene to add the animation to

params.name: animKey
params.description: The key that the animation will be associated with

params.name: frameKey
params.description: The key that describes the filename in the JSON

params.name: atlasKey
params.description: The key that describes the loaded Atlas

name: addDynamicAnim
description:
Adds a dynamic animation to the given scene. A dynamic animation is a
tradition animation where it looks like the entity is moving.

params.name: scene
params.description: The scene to add the animation to

params.name: animKey
params.description: The key that the animation will be associated with

params.name: framePrefix
params.description: The prefix of the key that describes the file

params.name: atlasKey
params.description: The key that describes the loaded Atlas

params.name: start
params.description: The number of the first frame

params.name: end
params.description: The number of the last frame

params.name: frameRate
params.description: The frame rate of playback in fps

params.name: repeat
params.description:
Number of times to repeat the animation (-1
 for infinity)

params.name: repeatDelay
params.description:
Delay before the animation repeats. Value
 given in milliseconds.

name: createAnimations
description: Creates all of the animations for entities

params.name: scene
params.description: The scene to add the animation to

name: src/util/KeyBinding.js
BINDINGS
description: Collection of common key bindings to use in the game

name: KeyBinding
description:
The KeyBinding utility class provides a convenient way to create key bindings
for a scene.

name: createKeys
description:
Creates a keys object based on the given bindings. This also adds the given
bindings to the given scene.

return.description: the constructed keys object

name: src/util/LightPipeline.js
TextureTintPipeline
description:
Constant used to simplify calling the
Phaser.Renderer.WebGL.Pipelines.TextureTintPipeline class

name: LIGHT_COUNT
description: The maximum number of lights allowed to render in a scene

name: LightPipeline
description:
Custom light pipeline to fix issues with the current diffuse lighting
pipeline.

name: active
description: Whether or not the pipeline is active

name: src/util/Random.js
Random
description:
A utility class that provides functions for random number generation based on
a given seed value

name: rng
description: The random number generator used for this instance

name: randInt
description: Gets a random integer

params.name: min
params.description: The minimum value the integer can be

params.name: max
params.description: The maximum value the integer can be

params.name: even
params.description:
True = Only Even, False = Only Odd,
         Undefined = Odd and Even

return.description: A random integer

name: randEvenInt
description: Gets a random even integer

params.name: min
params.description: The minimum value the integer can be

params.name: max
params.description: The maximum value the integer can be

return.description: A random even integer

name: randOddInt
description: Gets a random odd integer

params.name: min
params.description: The minimum value the integer can be

params.name: max
params.description: The maximum value the integer can be

return.description: A random odd integer

name: randDirection
description: Gets a random direction (North, East, South, West)

return.description: A random direction

name: randPick
description: Gets a random value in the given array

return.description: The chosen value of the array

content:
# Micrungeon [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/blackjack26/micrungeon.svg?branch=develop)](https://travis-ci.org/blackjack26/micrungeon)

## Set Up

### Clone Repository

Navigate into your workspace directory and run:

```sh
git clone https://github.com/blackjack26/micrungeon.git
```

### Install NodeJS and NPM

https://nodejs.org/en/

### Install Dependencies

Navigate to the cloned repo's directory and install dependencies:

```sh
cd /path/to/micrungeon
npm install
```

### Run the Development Server

The development server allows you to run the game in a browser. It also provides live-reloading for quicker development when files are changed.

Run the following command:

```sh
npm start
```

This should compile the source code to the `dev/` directory and open your browser to `localhost:3000`. If not, open your browser and navigate to `http://localhost:3000`.

### Build Production Code

To optimize and minimize the code for production deployment, run:

```sh
npm run deploy
```

The output of this command is in the `app/` directory. This command also creates an `.exe` file to install the game as a desktop app. This is located in the `build/dist` directory.

### Test & Documentation

To verify your code run:

```sh
npm test
```

To generate documentation based on the JSDoc comments, run:

```sh
npm run doc
```

## License

Micrungeon is released under the [MIT License](https://github.com/blackjack26/micrungeon/blob/develop/LICENSE)

## Authors

[Jack Grzechowiak](https://github.com/blackjack26)

[Phil Kirwin](https://github.com/philkir22)
name: ./README.md
package.json
